versions.notes: Initial model: 159 LLM-labeled real skills (60 SAFE, 95 CAUTION, 4 DANGEROUS). DANGEROUS class underrepresented.
QAT model with exact i32 integer-division simulation. 425 LLM-labeled real skills + 80 DANGEROUS + 26 SAFE anchor augmentation. Fixed quantization gap between Python float and Rust i32 inference.

Fixed critical DANGEROUS class imbalance (recall 9% → 93.7%). Added 10 features (35→45): 5 boundary-discriminating + 5 cross-features. Rebalanced class weights (danger_fn_weight=3), oversampled dangerous examples. Architecture: 45→56→40→3 (4,979 params).

Improved CAUTION recall (46.2% → 71.3%) and 3-class accuracy (62.2% → 66.1%). Tighter labeling criteria (6 behavioral triggers), boundary-region data enrichment (425 → 619 skills), reduced DANGEROUS over-optimization. Added rule-based safety floor for deterministic threat detection (reverse shells, data exfiltration, credential harvesting, curl|bash). Architecture unchanged: 45→56→40→3 (4,979 params).

Restored DANGEROUS recall to 91.3% (from 80.2% in v2.2). Danger-sensitive loss (weight=20), DANGEROUS-priority checkpoint selection, 4x hard negative mining, SMOTE oversampling (0.28). Added safe-floor rule to prevent false positives on trivially benign skills. Three-layer defense: MLP + 7 danger-floor rules + 1 safe-floor rule. i32 holdout DANGEROUS recall: 95.9%.
